gpt-message.content: You are an expert in hardware design with a deep understanding of Verilog RTL codes. Now I want to train a large language model for code comment generation tasks specifically focused on Verilog RTL codes. And I want you to help me process the raw data, transforming it into suitable formats that can serve as inputs and outputs for the model.

Name of the module and its functionality is as follows: 
Module name: mcb_soft_calibration

Explanation: This module appears to be a soft calibration controller for a memory controller block (MCB). It performs several calibration steps including:

1. Input termination calibration using RZQ and ZIO pins
2. DQS (Data Strobe) delay calibration
3. Dynamic calibration during operation

The module goes through various states to adjust termination values, set initial DQS delays, and continuously monitor and adjust DQS timing during operation. It interfaces with IODRP (I/O Device Reconfiguration Port) controllers to make these adjustments. The calibration process aims to optimize the timing and signal integrity for memory operations, adapting to temperature and voltage variations over time.

Input and output ports and their explanation is as follows: 
Input ports:
UI_CLK, RST, PLL_LOCK, SELFREFRESH_REQ, SELFREFRESH_MCB_MODE, RZQ_IN, RZQ_IODRP_SDO, ZIO_IN, ZIO_IODRP_SDO, MCB_UOSDO, MCB_UODONECAL, MCB_UOREFRSHFLAG, MCB_UODATA, MCB_UODATAVALID, MCB_UOCMDREADY, MCB_UO_CAL_START

Explanation:
UI_CLK: Main clock input for the module.
RST: Reset signal for the module.
PLL_LOCK: Indicates when the PLL is locked.
SELFREFRESH_REQ: Request for self-refresh mode.
SELFREFRESH_MCB_MODE: Indicates MCB is in self-refresh mode.
RZQ_IN, ZIO_IN: Input signals for calibration.
RZQ_IODRP_SDO, ZIO_IODRP_SDO: IODRP serial data outputs for RZQ and ZIO.
MCB_UOSDO: MCB user output serial data.
MCB_UODONECAL: Indicates MCB calibration is done.
MCB_UOREFRSHFLAG: MCB refresh flag.
MCB_UODATA: MCB user output data.
MCB_UODATAVALID: Indicates MCB output data is valid.
MCB_UOCMDREADY: Indicates MCB is ready for commands.
MCB_UO_CAL_START: Signals the start of MCB calibration.

Output ports:
DONE_SOFTANDHARD_CAL, SELFREFRESH_MCB_REQ, SELFREFRESH_MODE, IODRP_ADD, IODRP_SDI, RZQ_IODRP_CS, ZIO_IODRP_CS, MCB_UIADD, MCB_UISDI, MCB_UICS, MCB_UIDRPUPDATE, MCB_UIBROADCAST, MCB_UIADDR, MCB_UICMDEN, MCB_UIDONECAL, MCB_UIDQLOWERDEC, MCB_UIDQLOWERINC, MCB_UIDQUPPERDEC, MCB_UIDQUPPERINC, MCB_UILDQSDEC, MCB_UILDQSINC, MCB_UIREAD, MCB_UIUDQSDEC, MCB_UIUDQSINC, MCB_RECAL, MCB_UICMD, MCB_UICMDIN, MCB_UIDQCOUNT, MCB_SYSRST, Max_Value, CKE_Train

Explanation:
DONE_SOFTANDHARD_CAL: Indicates completion of soft and hard calibration.
SELFREFRESH_MCB_REQ: Request for MCB to enter self-refresh mode.
SELFREFRESH_MODE: Indicates the module is in self-refresh mode.
IODRP_ADD, IODRP_SDI: IODRP address and serial data input.
RZQ_IODRP_CS, ZIO_IODRP_CS: Chip select for RZQ and ZIO IODRPs.
MCB_UIADD, MCB_UISDI, MCB_UICS, MCB_UIBROADCAST: MCB user interface signals.
MCB_UIDRPUPDATE: Signal to update MCB IODRP.
MCB_UIADDR: MCB user interface address.
MCB_UICMDEN, MCB_UIDONECAL: MCB command enable and calibration done signals.
MCB_UIDQLOWERDEC, MCB_UIDQLOWERINC, MCB_UIDQUPPERDEC, MCB_UIDQUPPERINC: DQ calibration control signals.
MCB_UILDQSDEC, MCB_UILDQSINC, MCB_UIUDQSDEC, MCB_UIUDQSINC: LDQS and UDQS calibration control signals.
MCB_UIREAD: MCB read signal.
MCB_RECAL: MCB recalibration signal.
MCB_UICMD, MCB_UICMDIN, MCB_UIDQCOUNT: MCB command and DQ count signals.
MCB_SYSRST: System reset signal for MCB.
Max_Value: Maximum calibration value.
CKE_Train: CKE training signal.

Internal signals and their explanation is as follows: 
Internal signals:
STATE, P_Term, N_Term, P_Term_s, N_Term_s, P_Term_w, N_Term_w, P_Term_Prev, N_Term_Prev, IODRPCTRLR_MEMCELL_ADDR, IODRPCTRLR_WRITE_DATA, Active_IODRP, IODRPCTRLR_R_WB, IODRPCTRLR_CMD_VALID, IODRPCTRLR_USE_BKST, MCB_CMD_VALID, MCB_USE_BKST, Pre_SYSRST, IODRP_SDO, Max_Value_Previous, count, counter_en, First_Dyn_Cal_Done, DQS_DELAY_INITIAL, DQS_DELAY, TARGET_DQS_DELAY, counter_inc, counter_dec, RST_reg, Block_Reset, MCB_UODATAVALID_U, LastPass_DynCal, First_In_Term_Done.

Explanation:
STATE: Represents the current state of the calibration state machine.
P_Term, N_Term: Store the P-termination and N-termination values.
P_Term_s, N_Term_s, P_Term_w, N_Term_w: Skewed versions of P and N termination values.
P_Term_Prev, N_Term_Prev: Previous P and N termination values for comparison.
IODRPCTRLR_MEMCELL_ADDR: Address for IODRP controller memory cell.
IODRPCTRLR_WRITE_DATA: Data to be written to IODRP controller.
Active_IODRP: Indicates which IODRP is currently active (RZQ, ZIO, or MCB_PORT).
IODRPCTRLR_R_WB: Read/Write control for IODRP controller.
IODRPCTRLR_CMD_VALID, MCB_CMD_VALID: Command valid signals for IODRP and MCB.
IODRPCTRLR_USE_BKST, MCB_USE_BKST: Broadcast mode control for IODRP and MCB.
Pre_SYSRST: Internal reset signal.
IODRP_SDO: Serial data output for IODRP.
Max_Value_Previous: Stores the previous maximum calibration value.
count, counter_en: Counter and enable signal for timing purposes.
First_Dyn_Cal_Done: Flag indicating completion of first dynamic calibration.
DQS_DELAY_INITIAL, DQS_DELAY, TARGET_DQS_DELAY: DQS delay values for calibration.
counter_inc, counter_dec: Counters for incrementing and decrementing operations.
RST_reg: Registered reset signal.
Block_Reset: Signal to block reset during certain operations.
MCB_UODATAVALID_U: Registered version of MCB_UODATAVALID.
LastPass_DynCal: Indicates the type of last calibration pass (in-term or dynamic).
First_In_Term_Done: Flag indicating completion of first in-termination calibration.
